id: bigtech:lgs wallpaper oled tv returns to ces and its wafer thin:2026-01-05T03:00:00.000Z
title: LG’s Wallpaper OLED TV returns to CES, and it’s wafer thin
author: John.Higgins
summary_long: The amazingly thin wallpaper design from LG is back. The first Wallpaper TV was released back in 2017, and it's been six years since we saw the last one. But LG has revived the product line with the LG OLED evo W6, and I've seen it here at CES. The TV body is only 9mm thick (which is actually a bit more than the last model), thanks to a completely reengineered internal architecture. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2026-01-05. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:ikeas new 4 usbc charger is cheaper than apples and ankers:2026-01-05T01:54:29.000Z
title: Ikea’s new $4 USB-C charger is cheaper than Apple’s and Anker’s
author: Andrew Liszewski
summary_long: Ikea has released the most affordable version of its Sjöss USB-C chargers yet. Following an $8 30W version that launched in 2024 and a $35 65W option that debuted earlier this year, the new 20W Sjöss is now available online and through many of Ikea's physical US stores for just $3.99. That's considerably cheaper than Apple's $19 20W USB-C Power Adapter while being comparable in size, and cheaper than Anker's $11.99 Nano Pro 20W USB-C charger. However, Ikea's new $4 charger is much larger than Anker's, and is about 26 grams heavier. Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2026-01-05. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:withings updated body scan scale tracks 60 different biomark:2026-01-05T01:02:35.000Z
title: Withings' updated Body Scan scale tracks 60 different biomarkers
author: Daniel Cooper
summary_long: Back in 2023, Withings launched Body Scan, a super-premium scale with the sort of tech found in a high-end gym or low-end clinic. It had a six-lead ECG, offered segmented body composition and could monitor your nerve health, among other things. Now the company has rocked up at CES 2026 in Las Vegas with a second-generation model that adds in tests for hypertension and cellular health. Withings hopes the new model will give you even more data you can use to fight against chronic illnesses brought on by our decadent modern lifestyle. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2026-01-05. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:how to watch the lg ces 2026 press conference:2026-01-04T18:10:35.000Z
title: How to watch the LG CES 2026 press conference
author: Katie Teague
summary_long: For years, LG has opened CES press day with the first event of the morning. Though arch-rival Samsung getting the jump on its fellow Korean rival by giving its presentation the evening before, LG will be hitting the podium at breakfast time with the theme "Innovation in Tune with You." As with many tech-focused events nowadays, AI is expected to serve as the unifying thread of LG's CES 2026 presentation. That said, LG — much like Apple — has its own take on the acronym, referring to it as "Affectionate Intelligence." The company will share "its vision for elevating daily life through Affectionate Intelligence — delivering harmonized and seamlessly connected customer experiences." The irony, though, is that LG has already shown its cards, thanks to a long string of pre-show press releases offering details about a litany of new products (see below). HOW TO WATCH LG'S CES 2026 PRESENTATION The event will stream live from Las Vegas on Monday, January…

id: consumer:how to watch the intel ces 2026 launch event:2026-01-04T13:00:40.000Z
title: How to watch the Intel CES 2026 launch event
author: Katie Teague
summary_long: We're just hours away from the start of CES 2026, and with that comes Intel's launch event. The chip giant is expected to provide more details on its AI PC initiative and the new processors powering it: The Core Ultra Series 3 CPUs (aka Panther Lake) are made using an 18A process — that's 18 angstroms, or just under 2nm — and designed for high-end laptops and gaming devices. For Intel, the stakes at CES are higher than ever. In the past 12 months, both NVIDIA and the US government acquired ownership stakes in the company, helping nearly double the stock price by the end of the year. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2026-01-04. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: nextfrontiers:selfdriving cars could prevent over 1 million road injuries :2026-01-04T16:30:01.000Z
title: Self-driving cars could prevent over 1 million road injuries across the US by 2035
summary_long: Autonomous vehicles could dramatically reduce traffic accidents and injuries on U.S. roads. Drawing on historical data and current trends, a recent JAMA Surgery study projected that self-driving cars could prevent more than 1 million injuries between 2025 and 2035, resulting in a 3.6% reduction in traffic-related injuries over the next decade. Source: techxplore.com. Date: 2026-01-04. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.
